_description: Business Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating business/commercial insurance pages

data.intro_content: California businesses face unique risks from earthquakes and high litigation rates. Average business insurance costs are $1,800/year.
data.requirements_content: California requires workers' compensation for businesses with employees. General liability is recommended for all businesses.

cost_factors.description: More employees increases workers comp costs

coverage_types.name: General Liability
coverage_types.description: Covers third-party injury and property damage

faqs.question: Is business insurance required in California?
faqs.answer: Workers' compensation is required with employees. Other coverage types are recommended but not mandated.

faqs.question: What does general liability cover?
faqs.answer: Covers third-party bodily injury, property damage, and advertising injury claims.
